â€¢ Clean out your Inbox, Sent Items, and Deleted Items folders in your e-mail application on a regular basis.
â€¢ Clean up files and free up storage drive space and memory space occasionally to prevent performance
problems. See â€œPerformance and lockup problemsâ€ on page 135.
â€¢ Keep a log book. Entries might include major software or hardware changes, device-driver updates,
intermittent problems and what you did to resolve them, and other issues you might have experienced.
The cause of a problem might be change in hardware, change in software, or any other actions that might

content.content: M Series desktops (ThinkCentre) <> M93z All-in-One (ThinkCentre) <> desktop <> windows 10 | ccfl | 64gb | i3 <> â€¢ Empty your recycle bin on a regular basis.â€¢ Run the Windows Disk Defragmenter program occasionally to prevent performance problems caused byan excessive number of fragmented files.â€¢ Clean out your Inbox, Sent Items, and Deleted Items folders in your e-mail application on a regular basis.â€¢ Make backup copies of critical data on removable media memory at regular intervals and store theremovable media in a safe location. The frequency of making backup copies depends on how critical thedata is to you or your business. Lenovo makes a number of removable-media storage devices availableas options, such as CD-RW drives and recordable DVD drives.â€¢ Back up your entire hard disk drive on a regular basis.â€¢ Keep your computer software up-to-date. See â€œKeeping your computer current â€ on page 91 for moreinformation.â€¢ Keep a log book. Entries might include major software or hardware changes, device-driver updates,intermittent problems and what you did to resolve them, and any minor issues you might haveexperienced. A log book can help you or a Lenovo technician determine if a problem is related to changein hardware, change in software, or some other action that might have taken place.â€¢ Create Product Recovery discs. See â€œCreating and using recovery mediaâ€ on page 75 for more informationabout using Product Recovery discs to restore the hard disk drive to the factory default settings.

meta.keywords_document: Setup Utility program,Windows operating system,Lenovo Solution Center,Setup Utility,Windows,computer,Utility program,Lenovo Support Web,Open Control Panel,hard disk drive
meta.text_pdf:
â€¢ Empty your recycle bin on a regular basis.
â€¢ Run the Windows Disk Defragmenter program occasionally to prevent performance problems caused by
an excessive number of fragmented files.
â€¢ Clean out your Inbox, Sent Items, and Deleted Items folders in your e-mail application on a regular basis.
â€¢ Make backup copies of critical data on removable media memory at regular intervals and store the
removable media in a safe location. The frequency of making backup copies depends on how critical the
data is to you or your business. Lenovo makes a number of removable-media storage devices available
as options, such as CD-RW drives and recordable DVD drives.
â€¢ Back up your entire hard disk drive on a regular basis.
â€¢ Keep your computer software up-to-date. See â€œKeeping your computer current â€ on page 91 for more
information.
â€¢ Keep a log book. Entries might include major software or hardware changes, device-driver updates,
intermittent problems and what you did to resolve them, and any minor issues you might have
experienced. A log book can help you or a Lenovo technician determine if a problem is related to change
in hardware, change in software, or some other action that might have taken place.
â€¢ Create Product Recovery discs. See â€œCreating and using recovery mediaâ€ on page 75 for more information
about using Product Recovery discs to restore the hard disk drive to the factory default settings.

content.content: ThinkBook Series <> ThinkBook 16p G4 IRH <> laptop <> windows 10 | ccfl | 128gb | i7 <> Nighttime charge optimization affects battery charging during the night hours, the time when youâ€™re usually asleep. When it is enabled, the computer regularly adapts its charging behavior based on observation of when you plug in the computer at night and unplug it in the morning. During the nighttime, the battery is charged to a particular range and is kept within that range for an extended period, before being further charged to 100%. Nighttime charge optimization ensures safe charging during the night and is beneficial to the long-term health of the battery.

meta.keywords_document: Lenovo,Exit Saving Changes,BIOS setup utility,computer,Lenovo Smart Engine,Lenovo computers support,Password,BIOS setup,Lenovo Vantage,Lenovo computers
meta.text_pdf:
Nighttime charge optimization affects battery charging during the night hours, the time when youâ€™re usually 
asleep. When it is enabled, the computer regularly adapts its charging behavior based on observation of 
when you plug in the computer at night and unplug it in the morning. During the nighttime, the battery is 
charged to a particular range and is kept within that range for an extended period, before being further 
charged to 100%. Nighttime charge optimization ensures safe charging during the night and is beneficial to 
the long-term health of the battery.

1. Recharge the battery completely before using it. The battery is fully charged when the ac power
adapter is plugged in and the battery indicator is green.

blinking orange.

content.content: X Series Tablet laptops (ThinkPad) <> X230i Tablet Laptop (ThinkPad) <> laptop <> windows 10 | ccfl | 64gb | i3 <> Batteries can degrade when they are left unused for long periods of time. For some rechargeablebatteries (particularly Lithium Ion batteries), leaving a battery unused in a discharged state couldincrease the risk of a battery short circuit, which could shorten the life of the battery and also canpose a safety hazard. Do not let rechargeable Lithium-Ion batteries completely discharge or storethese batteries in a discharged state.

meta.keywords_document: computer,hard disk drive,hard disk password,Setup Notice window,Hard disk,Power Manager program,power,computer display,Lenovo,Lenovo support Web
meta.text_pdf:
Batteries can degrade when they are left unused for long periods of time. For some rechargeable
batteries (particularly Lithium Ion batteries), leaving a battery unused in a discharged state could
increase the risk of a battery short circuit, which could shorten the life of the battery and also can
pose a safety hazard. Do not let rechargeable Lithium-Ion batteries completely discharge or store
these batteries in a discharged state.
meta.keywords_page: battery,battery pack,Lithium Ion batteries,pack,rechargeable battery pack,rechargeable battery,Lithium Ion,Batteries,Rechargeable battery notice,rechargeable
